thread.title: Cavaliers star LeBron James calls for more gun control
thread.title_full: Cavaliers star LeBron James calls for more gun control

title: Cavaliers star LeBron James calls for more gun control
text:
Cavaliers star LeBron James calls for more gun control 
Tom Withers, THE ASSOCIATED PRESS First posted: Friday, October 02, 2015 02:39 PM EDT | Updated: Friday, October 02, 2015 02:51 PM EDT Cavaliers star LeBron James spoke after practice Friday about the need for stricter national gun laws following a school shooting in Oregon the day before. (Jason Miller/Getty Images/AFP) Kerr takes leave from Warriors for back rehab INDEPENDENCE, OHIO - 
LeBron James said "there's no room for guns" as he decried the latest tragedy involving a child being killed in Cleveland. 
James said he was at home with his three kids Thursday when he learned about the death of a 5-month-girl in a drive-by shooting -- the third fatal shooting of a child in the city in four weeks -- and "it automatically hit me." James initially reacted with several posts on Twitter, calling for calm and change. 
The NBA star, who has never shied away from political issues, spoke after practice Friday about the need for stricter national gun laws. 
James didn't hear President Barack Obama's impassioned speech following the mass shooting at an Oregon community college campus , but "I know what I see. I know how I feel." 
James believes some of the educational work he does with his family's foundation can help curb violence. Sponsored Links
